title: T206 Joss POR brown Hindu 1 of 2 known
author: JasonD08

posts.post_title: T206 Joss POR brown Hindu 1 of 2 known
posts.post_content:
As far as I know there is 1 other one.  Super appeal for the technical grade.  Clean crisp back.  SGC 30 due towrinkle near bottom. VGEX+ corners and centered well.  PP gift, check or MO.  Must have for the back collector. $7500 OBO.

[URL="[URL=http://s135.photobucket.com/user/iakona8/media/tobacco/Card-0012.jpg.html][IMG]http://i135.photobucket.com/albums/q138/iakona8/tobacco/Card-0012.jpg[/IMG][/URL]"][URL=http://s135.photobucket.com/user/iakona8/media/tobacco/Card-0012.jpg.html][IMG]http://i135.photobucket.com/albums/q138/iakona8/tobacco/Card-0012.jpg[/IMG][/URL][/URL]
[URL=http://s135.photobucket.com/user/iakona8/media/tobacco/Card-0013.jpg.html][IMG]http://i135.photobucket.com/albums/q138/iakona8/tobacco/Card-0013.jpg[/IMG][/URL]

Beautiful card... FYI.. While this is one of the tougher cads to find with a Hindu back, it is not 1 of 2... more like 1 of 7...

   Good luck. Be well Brian

Brian

Thanks.  Has there been more than 2 graded?  Last I checked 1 PSA and 1 SGC.  I could be wrong.  Unless you know of 5 more not graded. Just looked up pops…see 1 for PSA and this one for SGC.  There are actually more red hindus graded than brown in this pose.

Jason

Hi Jason.

I have seen a haggard looking SGC 1 on Ebay, a decent SGC 1.5 in Legendary, your very nice SGC 2 here on net54, and a very good looking PSA 4.5 on ebay, if I remember correctly.

Those pop reports do not really give the fully story, unfortunately.

Either way, wow, what a great card and a very lovely example you have! Best of luck to you.

Derek
There have been 4 graded by SGC and 2 by PSA plus the ones that PSA didn't designate the advertising brand on the flip.

[quote name="JasonD08" post=1344471]Brian

Thanks.  Has there been more than 2 graded?  Last I checked 1 PSA and 1 SGC.  I could be wrong.  Unless you know of 5 more not graded. Just looked up pops…see 1 for PSA and this one for SGC.  There are actually more red hindus graded than brown in this pose.

Jason[/QUOTE]

Brown Hindus were printed during the 150 series.  The Red Hindus were printed later.  His pitching pose is available with a Red Hindu back (but not a Brown Hindu).  Likewise, the portrait was not printed with a Red Hindu back.

Why is PSA report reflecting the 4.5 only and SGC shows 3 designated under what looks like Red Hindu and 1 (this SGC 30) in a separate report?  Not debating, just asking.  This one has the best frontal focus and color out of the 2 I know of.  If anyone has a scan of another to compare please feel free to share.

Jason

[quote name="JasonD08" post=1344499]Why is PSA report reflecting the 4.5 only and SGC shows 3 designated under what looks like Red Hindu and 1 (this SGC 30) in a separate report?  Not debating, just asking.  This one has the best frontal focus and color out of the 2 I know of.  If anyone has a scan of another to compare please feel free to share.

Jason[/QUOTE]

If I understand correctly, SGC did not used to designate between specific back variances, for example the difference between a Brown or Red Hindu. Perhaps they are mixing up the portrait Brown and the pitching Red and lumping them together? I am really not too sure to be honest.

Your card is lovely.
